intro: Oberonia dimorphophylla, commonly known as the two-leaf orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, with two distinct leaf forms on the same plant—one upright and one horizontal. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in a spike, typical of many orchid species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
